name: Computational stemmatology
description: Modeling the transmission line of ancient manuscript is mandatory to better understand textual transmission and the possible evolutions of textual traditions overtime. I am currently participating in the SHERBET project, and trying to reconstruct the lineage of the Qumran manuscripts, starting with Ben Sira's.

name: Computation and style
description: Stylistic analysis can offer a large insight into the authorship of a text, and the possible redactional influences on the text construction. I am currently investigating leveraging such tools for koin√© greek to better understand the formation of the synoptic Gospels. I am also studying the resemblance in terms of vocabulary use of the Greek and latin Bible.

name: Machine Learning and supercomputing
description: My PhD thesis deals on the improvement of the performance of supercomputers using black-box optimization. I am still exploring this venue of work with Soraya Zertal and Adrian Khelili by designing solutions for intelligent placement of files across the filesystems of hierarchical storage.
